info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 3:28AM EDT until March 25 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, The French Broad River exceeds bankfull at the gauge site. Isolated farmland flooding is occurring across the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting and is expected to fall below 10 feet late this afternoon. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
